What's in Ohio? I often asked that, until we stayed here. Urbana is a city of dollhouses. When you're not admiring the sunsets, or the cute town, you can hang back in this cute, comfortable studio.
Some pros:
-The tub, have you ever bathed in a $4k tub? You can here.
-The bed is super comfy, my fiancee wants to know what the pillow brand was.
-The tv- Works great with plenty of apps/easy to use.
-The hosts- They went above and beyond. Super kind, responsive, and generous.
-Murray the orange cat- She runs the Airbnb well, the best greeter you can have.
-The shower- It's like being on MTV Cribs.
Living without a full fridge posed some challenges because we're ice cream junkies, but we were able to fit some in there anyway, so it worked out.
The town is walkable, photogenic, and overall friendly. The lady and selection at The Merchant Shops are outstanding. People in reviews complained about the kids, but we had no trouble with anyone's kids.
We hope to return, and loved our stay

This was my first Airbnb trip, and it far exceeded my expectations! I stayed for 11 days just to get away. It's on the second floor above the hosts' residence but felt like I was in a home of my own. It was snowy and very cold outside (Jan-Feb), but inside was perfectly cozy! Each room has radiant heating along with a tower heater (the ones in the bedroom and living room room are oscillating with remotes), and there's also an electric fireplace in the living room. My little ESA LOVED curling up in front of them. There was a very brief power outage, but it was an easy fix; Lee Ann texted me back immediately to have me reset the breaker, and everything went back to normal. These things happen, especially in older homes; I only mention it to show how quickly she responded and resolved the problem!
I was also there during a major winter storm, Lee Ann offered to pick up provisions for me at Kroger before it hit so I wouldn't have to go out myself! When it was time to leave, Eric even scraped the ice off of my car.
It's conveniently close to a somewhat busy area, although I thought it would be farther out from the general sounds of traffic at night. This has nothing to do with the hosts or accommodations themselves and it's not excessive so most people won't notice, but I can be sensitive to noise, especially when trying to sleep. There was a loud sports car nearby that woke me up each day, but I was able to easily fall back asleep when it left. I've never slept on a memory foam mattress before, and the first night I thought it was way too firm.. but a few minutes later it was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in! Every night after that I looked forward to it and it immediately felt perfect. I was sad going back to my own bed!
I really could rave on and on about all of the positives. Lee Ann and Eric truly went above and beyond. Wonderful hosts and beautiful home, I recommend staying here 100%!

We had a wonderful time at Sara's place. The historic home was truly amazing. Beautifully decorated with lots of spaces to explore and enjoy. There are also great places to eat locally, and we enjoyed that.
Here are some tips I would give to prospective renters. Remember it's a very old, historic house so plumbing and electric reflect that. Electrical outlets in the bedrooms are few so bring an extension cord. Multiple people showering at the same time leads to low water pressure so time your showers. The home has lots of step ups and downs between rooms and lovely antique furniture and decorations so it might not be best for really young children (toddlers). Also, there are quite a few places where electrical outlets don't have a cover plate. That would be an easy fix for the owners but until that is taken care of it's a safety hazard for kids. But, having added those caveats, we thought it was an amazing place to gather a large group and we loved it there!
